styleGuide: 16-bit JRPG pixel art style. Clean, readable sprites with limited color palette per tile. Warm, inviting aesthetic inspired by SNES-era RPGs (Chrono Trigger, Secret of Mana, Final Fantasy VI). 2-3 head-tall chibi proportions for characters. 32x32 pixel tile grid. Subtle shading with 2-3 tone depth per surface. No outlines on tiles, clean edges on sprites. Bright, hopeful color philosophy — the world gets MORE vivid as it progresses, never darker. Think: watercolor sketch evolving into illuminated manuscript evolving into stained-glass cathedral light.

tiles.description: Semi-transparent blue-white (#B0C4DE at 70%) crystalline sheet. Base tile visible but desaturated beneath.

tiles.name: Crystal ground (thin)
tiles.description: Light frost layer (#E8E8E8 at 40%). Used at zone edges for gradual transition.

tiles.name: Crystal ground (cracked)
tiles.description: Post-breaking variant: fractured crystal fragments, warm light bleeding through cracks.

tiles.name: Crystal growth (small)
tiles.description: Blue-white crystal formation, 1 tile, sprouting from ground.

tiles.name: Crystal growth (medium)
tiles.description: Crystal cluster, 1 tile, taller formation with faceted surfaces.

tiles.name: Crystal growth (large)
tiles.description: Massive crystal formation, 2 tiles tall — use bottom tile on ground, top tile above.

tiles.name: Frozen object overlay
tiles.description: Prismatic frost coating applied over any decoration tile. Original object visible but ice-encased.

tiles.name: Frozen NPC indicator
tiles.description: Blue-tinted grayscale NPC silhouette placeholder. Actual NPC sprite is rendered separately with blue tint shader.

tiles.name: Frozen water
tiles.description: Water tile frozen mid-ripple: wave crests turned to ice, surface locked. Replaces animated water tiles.

tiles.name: Crystal focal point
tiles.description: Central stagnation object (varies by zone). Large crystal formation with internal glow. 2x2 tiles.

tiles.name: Stagnation border autotile
tiles.description: 47-tile blob set. Inner: crystal ground (STG-OV-01). Outer: transparent (base biome shows through). 2-tile-wide transition where normal tiles gradually gain crystal overlay.

tiles.name: Crystal shatter
tiles.description: Crystal fragments flying outward from impact point

tiles.name: Warm flood
tiles.description: Golden warmth (#DAA520) spreading to replace blue crystal

tiles.name: Thaw effect
tiles.description: Ice melting from objects, water dripping, color returning

assets.prompt:
16-bit JRPG pixel art style. Clean, readable sprites with limited color palette per tile. Warm, inviting aesthetic inspired by SNES-era RPGs (Chrono Trigger, Secret of Mana, Final Fantasy VI). 2-3 head-tall chibi proportions for characters. 32x32 pixel tile grid. Subtle shading with 2-3 tone depth per surface. No outlines on tiles, clean edges on sprites. Bright, hopeful color philosophy — the world gets MORE vivid as it progresses, never darker. Think: watercolor sketch evolving into illuminated manuscript evolving into stained-glass cathedral light.

Generate a stagnation/crystal overlay tileset for a 16-bit RPG. These are semi-transparent overlay tiles applied on top of other biomes to show crystallization/freezing. 16 columns × 10 rows of 32x32 pixel tiles, blue-white crystalline aesthetic. Used for Preserver zones where everything is frozen in crystal:
- Crystal ground (full): Semi-transparent blue-white (#B0C4DE at 70%) crystalline sheet. Base tile visible but desaturated beneath.
- Crystal ground (thin): Light frost layer (#E8E8E8 at 40%). Used at zone edges for gradual transition.
- Crystal ground (cracked): Post-breaking variant: fractured crystal fragments, warm light bleeding through cracks.
- Crystal growth (small): Blue-white crystal formation, 1 tile, sprouting from ground.
- Crystal growth (medium): Crystal cluster, 1 tile, taller formation with faceted surfaces.
- Crystal growth (large): Massive crystal formation, 2 tiles tall — use bottom tile on ground, top tile above.
- Frozen object overlay: Prismatic frost coating applied over any decoration tile. Original object visible but ice-encased.
- Frozen NPC indicator: Blue-tinted grayscale NPC silhouette placeholder. Actual NPC sprite is rendered separately with blue tint shader.
- Frozen water: Water tile frozen mid-ripple: wave crests turned to ice, surface locked. Replaces animated water tiles.
- Crystal focal point: Central stagnation object (varies by zone). Large crystal formation with internal glow. 2x2 tiles.
- Stagnation border autotile: 47-tile blob set. Inner: crystal ground (STG-OV-01). Outer: transparent (base biome shows through). 2-tile-wide transition where normal tiles gradually gain crystal overlay.
- Crystal shatter: Crystal fragments flying outward from impact point
- Warm flood: Golden warmth (#DAA520) spreading to replace blue crystal
- Thaw effect: Ice melting from objects, water dripping, color returning

Color palette: crystal blue-white (#B0C4DE), fading to (#E8E8E8). Single variant — stagnation appearance does not change with vibrancy tier.

Warm, inviting aesthetic inspired by SNES-era RPGs (Chrono Trigger, Secret of Mana, Final Fantasy VI). 2-3 head-tall chibi proportions for characters. 32x32 pixel tile grid. Subtle shading with 2-3 tone depth per surface. No outlines on tiles, clean edges on sprites. Bright, hopeful color philosophy — the world gets MORE vivid as it progresses, never darker. Think: watercolor sketch evolving into illuminated manuscript evolving into stained-glass cathedral light.

Normal vibrancy tier (34-66). Full natural color palette. Rich greens, warm golds, deep sky blues. Think: golden hour meadow, illuminated manuscript. Clear detail in textures, visible patterns, natural world at its most comfortable. Moderate environmental detail, some decorative elements.

Generate a biome transition autotile set for a 16-bit RPG. This tileset blends the "marsh" biome into the "sketch" biome at normal vibrancy. 16 columns × 6 rows of 32x32 tiles. Contains a 47-tile blob autotile set for smooth edge transitions. Inner tiles: sketch biome ground tile. Outer tiles: marsh biome ground tile. Edge pixels: 4-pixel gradient blend between biome palettes. No hard lines — every transition must be visually smooth at the tile boundary. Used at: Shimmer Marsh -> Luminous Wastes.
